body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install py-gosam
```


### Error message

```
    usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
       or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
       or: setup.py --help-commands
       or: setup.py cmd --help

    error: option --single-version-externally-managed not recognized
    Running setup.py install for gosam: finished with status 'error'
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.17.1-1370-10f3113b3c
* **Python:** 3.8.10
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake_avx512
* **Concretizer:** clingo

### Additional information

Logs for Spack develop: https://gist.github.com/05e70d6f71a66a318fceb3f238264887

py-gosam installs with 0.17.0 (but only if checking the source from git, if the code is fetched from mirror the installation fails due to missing .git directory): https://gist.github.com/b47a4c577ddf8ac0ff86ad56cf2b8128



### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and **@mentioned** any maintainers
- [X] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: py-gosam
